sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Pods are the computing units of &kube; and consist of one or more containers. A pod has its own unique network IP and storage resources. To scale an application, multiple pods with the same container can be started. The load is automatically distributed among the cluster nodes.
A very good introduction to starting an application in a pod is available at .
For more information about pods, refer to .

sect1.title: Creating Pods
sect1.para: To create a pod, first define it in a YAML file. The used containers must be available in the registry.

example.title: Pod with nginx-container
example.screen: apiVersion: v1 kind: Pod metadata: name: nginx spec: containers: - name: nginx image: nginx:1.7.9 ports: - containerPort: 80

sect1.para: Then apply the YAML file with kubectl create -f YAML_FILE.

sect1.title: Killing Pods
sect1.para: To kill a running pod, use kubectl delete pod POD_NAME. The POD_NAME refers to the name value of the metadata section. By default, the pod is granted a grace period of 30 seconds to shut down. After that, it will be killed.

sect1.title: List Running Pods
sect1.para: To list running pods, run kubectl get pods.
